item.title: Jill add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jill add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jill add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "More than any other time in history, mankind faces a crossroads. One path leads to despair and utter hopelessness. The other, to total extinction. Let us pray we have the wisdom to choose correctly." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Jill add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I'm a greater believer in luck, and I find the harder I work the more I have of it" -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Jill add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Who, being loved, is poor?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jill add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jill add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jill add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Jill add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Jill add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Jill add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "What a strange illusion it is to suppose that beauty is goodness." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Jill add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "I heard the bells on Christmas Day Their old, familiar carols play, And wild and sweet The words repeat Of peace on earth, good-will to men!" -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Jill add a quote by Roy L. Smith
item.description: "He who has not Christmas in his heart will never find it under a tree." -- Roy L. Smith

item.title: Jill add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "We are not enemies, but friends. We must not be enemies. Though passion may have strained, it must not break our bonds of affection. The mystic chords of memory will swell when again touched, as surely they will be, by the better angels of our nature." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jill add a quote by Robert F. Kennedy
item.description: "Few will have the greatness to bend history itself, but each of us can work to change a small portion of events. It is from numberless diverse acts of courage and belief that human history is shaped. Each time a man stands up for an ideal, or acts to improve the lot of others, or strikes out against injustice, he sends forth a tiny ripple of hope, and crossing each other from a million different centers of energy and daring those ripples build a current which can sweep down the mightiest walls of oppression and resistance." -- Robert F. Kennedy

item.title: Jill add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Truth is on the side of the oppressed." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Jill add a quote by Piero Ferrucci
item.description: "If kindness has falseness at its base, it is no longer kindness. It is labored courtesy." -- Piero Ferrucci
